name: Physical Protection (Limit physical access to information systems and facilities)

items.question: PE.L1-3.10.1 - Physical Access Authorization
1. Authorized Personnel Inventory
How many individuals are authorized for physical access to FCI areas (fill in the total for each)?

items.codingInstructions: Maintain an updated list of individuals authorized to access secure physical areas to ensure proper access control.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Maintain an updated list of individuals authorized to access secure physical areas to ensure proper access control.

items.question: 2. Physical Access Areas
What areas require controlled physical access?

answers.text: Conference rooms used for FCI discussions

items.codingInstructions: Control and restrict access to sensitive physical locations to prevent unauthorized entry and protect assets.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Control and restrict access to sensitive physical locations to prevent unauthorized entry and protect assets.

items.question: 3. Authorization Process
Who authorizes physical access to controlled areas?

items.codingInstructions: Establish formal procedures to grant, review, and revoke physical access permissions for personnel.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Establish formal procedures to grant, review, and revoke physical access permissions for personnel.

items.question: 4. Access Credentials
What types of physical access credentials are issued?

items.codingInstructions: Issue and manage secure access credentials to verify and control entry to restricted physical areas.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Issue and manage secure access credentials to verify and control entry to restricted physical areas.

items.question: 5. Time-Based Access Restrictions
Are there time-based restrictions on physical access?

items.codingInstructions: Limit physical access to authorized areas during specific times to reduce security risks outside business hours.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Limit physical access to authorized areas during specific times to reduce security risks outside business hours.

items.codingInstructions: Limit physical access to organizational information systems, equipment, and the respective operating environments to authorized individuals
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Limit physical access to organizational information systems, equipment, and the respective operating environments to authorized individuals

items.question: PE.L1-3.10.3 - Escort Visitors
1. Visitor Escort Policy
Does your organization require all visitors to be escorted?

answers.text: Yes, all visitors must be escorted at all times
Yes, but only in restricted areas

value.text: Yes, all visitors must be escorted at all times

items.codingInstructions: Require authorized personnel to accompany visitors while they are in secure areas to ensure safety and security.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Require authorized personnel to accompany visitors while they are in secure areas to ensure safety and security.

items.question: 2. Visitor Identification
How are visitors identified and distinguished from employees?

items.codingInstructions: Implement procedures to verify and record visitor identities before granting physical access to facilities.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Implement procedures to verify and record visitor identities before granting physical access to facilities.

items.question: 3. Visitor Activity Monitoring
How is visitor activity monitored while on premises?

answers.text: Physical access restrictions to sensitive areas

value.text: Physical access restrictions to sensitive areas

items.codingInstructions: Track and record visitor movements within facilities to detect and prevent unauthorized activities.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Track and record visitor movements within facilities to detect and prevent unauthorized activities.

items.question: 4. Escort Authorization
Who is authorized to escort visitors?

items.codingInstructions: Define who is permitted to escort visitors and ensure they understand their responsibilities for security and supervision.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Define who is permitted to escort visitors and ensure they understand their responsibilities for security and supervision.

items.codingInstructions: Escort visitors and monitor visitor activity
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Escort visitors and monitor visitor activity

items.question: 1. Access Logging Methods
How do you log physical access to your facilities?

answers.text: Electronic badge readers with automatic logging
Physical key assignment and tracking logs

value.text: Electronic badge readers with automatic logging

items.codingInstructions: Implement methods to accurately record entry and exit activities in secure areas for audit and investigation purposes.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Implement methods to accurately record entry and exit activities in secure areas for audit and investigation purposes.

items.question: 2. Information Captured in Logs
What information is captured in your physical access logs Information Captured in Logs?

answers.text: Person's identity (name, employee ID, visitor ID)

value.text: Person's identity (name, employee ID, visitor ID)

items.codingInstructions: Record key details such as date, time, personnel identity, and access points to ensure comprehensive tracking of physical access events.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Record key details such as date, time, personnel identity, and access points to ensure comprehensive tracking of physical access events.

items.question: 3. Log Retention and Review
How long are physical access logs retained?
How frequently are access logs reviewed?
Who reviews the physical access logs?

items.codingInstructions: Maintain and regularly review access logs to detect anomalies and support security investigations.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Maintain and regularly review access logs to detect anomalies and support security investigations.

items.question: 1. Physical Access Device Inventory
What types of physical access devices does your organization use?

answers.text: Biometric scanners (fingerprint, retina, etc.) Smart cards with embedded chips
Mobile phone apps for access control

value.text: Biometric scanners (fingerprint, retina, etc.) Smart cards with embedded chips

items.codingInstructions: Keep an up-to-date inventory of all devices used to control physical access, such as card readers and locks, to ensure proper management and security.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Keep an up-to-date inventory of all devices used to control physical access, such as card readers and locks, to ensure proper management and security.

items.question: 2. Device Control and Management
How are physical access devices controlled and managed?

answers.text: Device return procedures for departing employees
Procedures for lost or stolen devices
Ability to quickly revoke device access

value.text: Device return procedures for departing employees

items.codingInstructions: Implement procedures to configure, monitor, and maintain physical access devices to prevent unauthorized use or tampering.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Implement procedures to configure, monitor, and maintain physical access devices to prevent unauthorized use or tampering.

items.question: 3. Device Security Measures
What security measures protect physical access devices?

answers.text: Device expiration dates and automatic deactivation

value.text: Device expiration dates and automatic deactivation

items.codingInstructions: Apply security controls to protect physical access devices from damage, tampering, or unauthorized modification.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Apply security controls to protect physical access devices from damage, tampering, or unauthorized modification.

items.question: 4. Device Maintenance and Updates
How frequently are electronic access systems updated?

items.codingInstructions: Regularly perform maintenance and apply updates to physical access devices to ensure their reliability and security.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Regularly perform maintenance and apply updates to physical access devices to ensure their reliability and security.
